Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tornportraits
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at Hotel Keizershof. We came to Amsterdam for the art museums and the tulips, both of which were incredible. But it was our stay at Hotel Keizershof that we both agreed was the highlight. The breakfast each morning, talking with the other guests, getting tips from the Hotel owners on what to do and where to eat, and the back yard garden made it such a wonderful experience. We loved our room - Mae West - and the view out our window, especially at night, was intoxicating. We opened a bottle of wine and soaked it in. Close to everything, we walked to everything we did.

Reviews.Title: “family hospitality in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pedrosocal
Reviews.Content: My fifth trip to Amsterdam and forth stay at the Hotel Keizershof on the Keizersgracht in Central city. It is convenient to everything. clean and comfortable, and reasonably priced. Several rooms have canal views, but I stayed in the room with a view of their lovely quiet garden. Best of all you have a breakfast each morning prepared by one of the family, and sit with an international group around the breakfast table. Hanneke brings you hot, fresh coffee and Mary fixes an omelet. Fresh baked bread, fresh fruit, and fresh juice. This morning I met a couple from Brazil, another from France, and a third are Italian but live in Ireland. Some are going to museums today, some to shop, all withing walking distance. Who knows who I'll meet over breakfast the next time I'm here?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Keizershof”
Reviews.Author: yb_silvis
Reviews.Content: Had some slight trouble looking for the trams from Centraal station to Keizergracht but we managed to find the hotel. Had to ring the bell a couple of times, even went to ring the door upstairs which I've found out it wasn't connected to the hotel. Was welcomed by one of the owner. Stairs were quite steep going to our room. Room was spacious and lovely. Had recommendations from them to try Walem for lunch which we did. Breakfast was truly sublime with a lot of food to choose from. Their omelettes are made when requested. Will book with this hotel again should I decide to come back to visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: Essexgal64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights from Sat to Mon recently. We found the hotel clean and ideally situated to access all the sights. In a quieter area of the city, but near to two different tram stops, this hotel offers everything the traveller would need. The owners are courteous,but not over friendly, the breakfast is comprehensive with home made bread and cakes, fresh fruit salad and many varieties of cheese. You also have the option of a herb omelette, which I would recommend. You should also try the Stroop Wafels...delicious. The rooms have everything you need and are cleaned on a daily basis. We had the room on the topmost floor overlooking the garden which was peaceful and quiet. The only downside to be aware of is the stairs, already mentioned on this site many times. It is 60 very steep and narrow stairs to the top floor, not to be undertaken by the feint hearted! It certainly helps to burn off those breakfasts! My only issue would be the shower; hard to get any more than a drizzle from the hand held shower head, made rinsing shampoo long and tedious. Also difficult to get the water temperature right.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: MyDearWatsonAu
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel Keizershof. Our hosts were wonderful, the breakfasts delicious - homemade bread in particular. We stayed in 2 rooms on the 3rd floor and were very comfortable. The view over the canal was fabulous. The location is very central. The room was clean and comfortably furnished. We'd recommend this hotel to any friends visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ,close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Tom5671
Reviews.Content: I am very faithful in all recommendations from Rick Steve.This hotel was an another nice experience.The hotel is located 4 easy tram stops from Amsterdam Central. It is also very close to any attractions Amsterdam may offer for you.Our room was on the 3rd floor . Spiral staircase was something new for us.The room was clean and overlooking the backyard.The breakfast was very tasty and served in a very nice , large family room. Every member of De Vries Family(owners) was extremely friendly and helpful. Ernest liked to chat with us.He was very helpful with practical information when our credit card did not have the newest chip which is required in public places in Holland for example train station. If I am next time in Amsterdam this will be my place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice”
Reviews.Author: ronp1954
Reviews.Content: We selected this family run hotel from Trip Advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived, Mary and Ernest made us feel very welcome. We had the first floor room overlooking the back garden and it was a very good sized room. Downside was the small bathroom and the small toilet outside the door, but then again you don't spend too much time in them so it didn't bother us. Built in 1672, so no lifts, just a lot of steep stairs which kept us fit. Ernest had a very good sense of humour and was a fountain of knowledge for attractions and places to dine. Hotel is in good location for sightseeing and in a safe area, just watch out for the bikes, they are everywhere. Breakfast was a delight with freshly baked breads with a large variety of toppings, plus pastries. Will certainly book here again when next in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gwen K
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this small, family run hotel. The DeVries family makes you feel very welcome in their home and the warmth and ambience of the kitchen and breakfast room is lovely. I had a room facing a quiet garden on the top floor. The location is perfect for museums, just steps from the Photography Museum and nestled on one of the prettiest canals in Amsterdam. Also recommend Moorland for dinner, just two blocks away. One tip, they prefer to be paid in cash, which I didn't realize until I got there.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Amsterdam (Tony B)”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: The welcome at this family run hotel was warm and friendly and certainly got our short stay off to a good start. Lovely filling breakfasts and our room was perfectly adequate for our needs (the narrow winding stairs to the third floor required some degree of fitness though). Ideally situated for seeing picturesque Amsterdam as most of the "sights" are within easy walking distance. I would certainly stay at this hotel on subsequent visits to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Highlight”
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: Our hosts welcomed us like family. Sent us off every morning with a wonderful breakfast. Room was very nice (although at the top of three winding flights of stairs.) Location was great. Highly recommended....we'll stay there again upon our return to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Dutch experience”
Reviews.Author: Caragh K
Reviews.Content: Cosy hotel, beautiful views, yummy breakfast and very welcoming laid back family

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay - slow service”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: On our first night we discovered that the room had no light bulbs. The next morning we requested light bulbs from the owner. She told us 'americans must have taken them'. What a ridiculous statement - tourists come to Amsterdam to take breakable light bulbs so that they can carry them around on the rest of their trips. And even if americans did take them, why didn't housekeeping notice the missing bulbs when they cleaned? Later that night, still no bulbs. The following morning we noticed a plastic bag hanging on coat hook near the breakfast room with light bulbs in it - they expected us to replace them and didn't even bother to tell us. When we asked for cozy nearby restaurant recommendation, she directed us to a directed to a nearby street that was nothing but restaurants. We got the general feeling that hotel guests were an annoyance to the owners and they did the minimum to get by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DrBobCheshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an enjoyable 5 nights here. Location is excellent, great restaurants, shopping and museums all within easy walking distance. Great breakfasts and very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is full of character. We stayed in the John Wayne room on the top (4th floor) which was really spacious with great views - you can see the Rijkmuseum from it. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop Your Search! This is It!”
Reviews.Author: gentay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of June with 2 Grand-Teens 13-14, and we all LOVED it. The location is perfect. Walk to everything. Sits right on the canal, circa 1670's, is spotless and so charming. It is just what you think of. Teens loved the stairs. Our (2) 3rd floor rooms overlooked the beautiful gardens with high windows that we opened at night. It is a residential neighborhood, yet steps from restaurants, pastry and cheese shops. You get the sense of living in Amsterdam. The breakfast is served all at one big table allowing us to enjoy the company of the other guests and share our experiences. The breakfasts are amazing!!! Cooked to order omelettes, cheeses, homemade divine pastries and so so much more. Hope you get to stay here. It was a highlight of our trip to Europe for our teens. Gentay in California

Reviews.Title: “Walk out your door to a picturesque canal”
Reviews.Author: yoido
Reviews.Content: Especially good location for the museum area and central Amsterdam as well as just around the corner from many nice antique shops. B&B has been in the family for generations so you do get an older homey feel. Our room was bright and spacious but be careful of the shower. Hot water for sure as the 2 inch burn mark on my arm will attest. Shower pipes are extremely hot!! And as mentioned in other reviews if you have any issue with stairs this is not your place. Hanneke very friendly but cost conscious. Payment is in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous hospitality”
Reviews.Author: cloudykaleigh
Reviews.Content: Mary and Hanneke couldn't have been any more gracious hosts. They have opened up their lovely canal house to travelers for many years, and they make you feel just like part of the family. The breakfast every morning is wonderful, and talking to Mary and Hanneke, as well as the other guests as we all start our day, is a treat. The rooms and shared toilet are adequate and nothing fancy, and the spiraling stairs are steep and narrow. But that's part of its uniqueness and charm, as this is far from being a cookie-cutter hotel chain. If you are looking for a great location and a nice place to call home while spending time in Amsterdam, look no further. I hope to return to Hotel Keizershof soon.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Julia D
Reviews.Content: As a single travelling trough Europe you'll find most things are more expensive and less good for you. Not so here!! I had a HUGE room overlooking the gardens ,,the city and the ryksmuseum in the background, hot shower and a separate toilet in the room, clean fresh and airy. My room was on the 4th floor,a long way up but as the owner remarked, " I didn't carry my whole house around " No I travel light. Yes it was high and steep but it's the original staircase from 1670 when the house was built My hosts Hannaka, Ernest and Mary were more than welcoming and entertaining,, good advice on ( vegetarian) restaurants , where to go and what to do, and where not. The breakfast is huge ,, not ready mades as you get in big hotels but freshly made .great coffee, breads, pancakes ,5 types of cheese,fresh fruits, Mary's unbeatable eggs ;-) You sit around a large table with the other guests talking while the food keeps comming All in all I had great fun at the hotel Keizershof and Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts, lots of personality and what a view”
Reviews.Author: Patricia D
Reviews.Content: This 17th century canal house sits right on Keizersgracht Canal so that when you walk out your front door you are greeted with a wonderful taste of what makes Amsterdam so charming. This is a family-run hotel, a mother-daughter team with help as needed from brother. Breakfast was an international delight, family-style around a big table with guests from every part of the globe and good conversation to start the day. The food was outstanding with fresh bread, omelets, pancakes, a variety of Dutch cheeses and fresh fruit and yogurt, probably the best we had during our trip. Our room was large en-suite with a view of the beautiful family garden which also has benches and tables set up so that guests can relax in a quiet setting, a respite from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. The location is perfect, just off the tram route but far enough from the center of the city to be less noisy. Lots of great restaurants are within a short walk. The only drawback, which is common in these wonderful canal houses, is that there is no elevator and rooms are on the third floor up a narrow, winding staircase. Anyone with health issues might opt for something less interesting but more convenient. We found it to be a great way to work off our scrumptious breakfast meal before hitting the streets of Amsterdam. We would be hard-pressed to stay elsewhere on a return to Amsterdam. We felt we made new friends there.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: citycolleen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 4 friends over the summer, our hosts were WONDERFUL, the view was great (canal or garden), rooms were clean, beds comfy. I will warn you there are some serious stairs in this place (pack light or ask for a room on the first floor... mind you this is one floor up from street level) but the overall experience was well worth it! our hosts made great recomendations (such as the french resturant down the street and a day trip to see windmills) and also turned us on to stroof waffles (a wonderful wonderful honey waffle cookie)! everyone morning we were treated to a fantastic breakfast. our hosts told us when we arrived to make ourselves at home and we did! being away from home it was nice to visit with the hotel pets... dog and cats, very polite and well trained (don't worry, no pet smells!) another interesting thing about this hotel is that it shares space with an office building, its hard to describe but its a really fun memory from the trip! shared bathrooms were no problem, other guests were friendly (and mostly fellow rick steves devotees) over all i'd recomend this place =)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: JanineL1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accommodations, meals and hospitality. The best hotel of our trip. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Liz3
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Mary for providing us with two great nights in Amsterdam. As reported in other posts, the stairs are very windy and steep and it is up to you to lug your bag up to the top floor if that is where your room is. The good news is that the hotel is right on the canal and you get a great view from your window. The room was large with big windows. We had our own shower, the toilet was shared, however this was not a problem. The hotel is central to all of the major attractions. The breakfasts are delicious and generous. One problem was that the WIFI was not working. There was never more than one bars strength, even when I took our laptop down to the breakfast room, where I was advised that I would receive better reception. Due to this, we had to go to an internet cafe. If you are planning on using WIFI, I would check the availability before booking. Apart from that, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome to a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakjc2
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Keizershof mid-morning after a long flight from Houston. It was cold and rainy outside. Inside we were welcomed with friendly smiles and a warm dining area where we were offered a cup of hot tea. Later when we went to our room on the 3rd floor (note that the winding stairs are very steep, so walk carefully), it was large and spacious, with a private bath and a view looking out over the green common area of the neighborhood. It was bright, cheery, clean, the beds very comfortable, and a place to hang clothes, a table to sit at and have a hot cup of tea (tea, coffee, and a way to heat water were very handy). The shower worked well and there was plenty of hot water. The owner was friendly and very helpful with suggestions on places to eat, where to go and what to see, calling a taxi when we needed one. etc. The breakfast was hearty: freshly brewed tea or coffee, rolls, sweets, cheeses, breads, cereals, eggs cooked to order, all of it very fresh and tasy, and more than enough to get us on our way. The location, on the Keizershof Canal was a short lazy 10minute walk to the Rijks Museum, the Van Gogh Museum, Ann Frank House, shopping, and good restaurants. Not right downtown, but still in the center of much activity. We were very pleased with this Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: pemquid
Reviews.Content: Concurring with what many others have said, this is a great place to stay. The rooms are large (we stayed in 2 different ones), hosts are wonderful, and the breakfasts are yummy and bountiful. There are even a couple of cute kitties for us cat-lovers. One of the rooms we stayed in (John Wayne-top floor garden view room) is in need of a bit of maintenance: one blind which was held up by tape fell down; most of the light switches didn't on anything, and the room could use a little more in the way of functioning lights. Biggest problem was very low water pressure in the shower, and a non-working bathroom exhaust fan. There was a distinctively bad (sulfur-like) odor in the room, which we believe was rising up from the shower drain. In spite of these minor problems, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wants to experience being in a house in a canal neighborhood. As an aside, I have no idea why this is called a hotel in its name and classed as a hotel in TripAdvisor and not a B&B. There are not a lot of rooms for rent now, though in the past there apparently used to be more; two of the floors (the middle two) are rented out as office space.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hosts, great location”
Reviews.Author: niayc
Reviews.Content: a very good value for the money. Great, convenient location. Delicious breakfast. The host was funny, helpful, and generous. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Well situated, Cozy, Copious breakfast and Super Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: kbortnick
Reviews.Content: The proprietor is particularly welcoming. Located just a few blocks away from the best museums. It is in the most quaint neighborhood of the city. It is near the park.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely personal hotel with fantastic food”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelnz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely location, close to food, transport and museums. Its like staying in a family home. Very welcoming and friendly. The only negative is the stairs as it doesn't have an elevator. Don't let that put you off as our stay was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BarAr
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the Charlie Chaplin room, which was big and comfortable with an always clean toilet in the hall. The stairs are indeed steep, but didn't bother us. The location is very central (and we like to walk so we seldom used the trams), but on a fairly quiet street even with the party boats going by on the canal. Annika and Ernst were great hosts. They have a sense of humor and were honest and helpful in their advice. (They recommended that we rent bikes to go OUT of town rather than navigate the traffic in town!) The highlight was breakfast. Fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, tomato/cucumber/cheese salad, amazing fresh bread with meats and cheeses, pancakes and omelets to order. Ernst sent us off with a package of stroopwafels (look it up) for the train ride to Germany.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Value”
Reviews.Author: guillaume22
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because its price was acceptable as hotels in Amesterdam were expensive. After staying there, I found it was indeed a good value and characteristic. It is actually a B&B; a decent breakfast is supplied, so every morning you can chat with fellow travelers and your hosts. The room we stayed is larger than a standard Novetel hotel room, and is clean and comfortable. The shower room and toilet are not large. The hotel is situated in a quite neighborhood, and is closed to boutique antique/paint shops. Taking a stroll around the neighborhood can make you to appreciate the life in Amesterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly, and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: canadian201107
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this bed and breakfast. The breakfasts themselves were phenomenal. There is something for everyone and the omlettes are heavenly and the fresh fruit was sweet and a great way to start the morning. They also had a great selection of teas. We had two rooms and the beds were comfortable. The room overlooking the canal was noisy at night (the water caries the sound and we were there over a weekend). Our hosts were friendly, helpful and gave us great suggestions both of things to do and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Central, Delicious, and Caring Hospitality--Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: jsdarnold
Reviews.Content: My husband was sent to Amsterdam on business and brought me along for a couple of days of sight-seeing. I am always a bit apprehensive about traveling internationally as I have some health difficulties (including food allergies) and work that requires consistent internet access. In traveling, I often feel that I have to fight every bit of the way to find food that I can eat, places where I can plug in and work for a decent price, and people who are able and willing to help a dumb American tourist find her way around. Hotel Keizershof has far exceeded my (and my husband's) expectations. We originally chose this hotel due to price, free wifi, and availability. When we arrived, we were surprised by the central, historic location. Located in a charming canal house on the 17th century Keizersgracht canal, the hotel is about a five minute tram ride from Centraal Station and an easy walk to many major museums, shopping areas, and good restaurants. At check in, we were pleasantly surprised by our hosts' mastery of the English language, delightful ease of manner, and sense of humor. They were immediately drawing out maps of the best places to go see, eat, and do and asking if we had special requests for breakfast. We awoke to a huge spread of fresh cheeses, fruits, homemade breads, preserves, and hot dutch pancakes. Upon hearing of my food allergies, our host went out and bought a vast array of gluten free breads, etc. for my next morning's breakfast. At check-out, we were sent with a bag of breads and pastries for the road:-) This was (sadly) our last morning here. At breakfast, we met a man who said he had been coming here for 24 years--I think we might follow suit.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for.”
Reviews.Author: MarkoMinden_NV
Reviews.Content: Hotel Keizershof was exactly the lodging in Amsterdam I was looking for. From a prior visit, I longed to see what one of those lovely old Amsterdam houses was like on the inside. And K. is exactly that. One enters the seven-story building through a fine old door at the ground floor, proceeds through a marble-floored hall (and on to a cozy, modern kitchen and dining area and adjacent living room if you go that far) to the STAIRWAY, a fantastic narrow, wooden spiral stairway that will take you up four flights, if you let it. Just beautiful, but not for the faint of heart. We got off on the 4th floor, found our room from among the four there, engaged key in lock, swung open the door, and were presented with a beautiful room, large, very clean, with a whole wall of windows looking out to the canal and street and all the fascinating architecture across the way. What a breath of fresh air, coming as we were from our â€œclosetâ€� of a room in Paris that day! We even had fresh-cut flowers and little chocolate Easter eggs. The bed was big and comfortable and clean, there was a TV, sitting chairs, table, chest-of-drawers and closet, and coffee in the room. Our room had a bathroom consisting of a sink and shower. We used the toilet facilities in the hall, which was not a problemâ€”we were the only ones to use it. Let me reiterate, every thing is very clean. The room was quiet with no problematic street noise, and the hotel itself was very quiet. The breakfasts prepared by Mary and her son were excellent and abundant in a convivial setting with the other guests. Maryâ€™s gracious nature is evident everywhere; she chats with guests if they want to, offers advice to local spots, and makes her place feel welcoming with may extra touches. K. is very well located and we walked everywhere we wanted to go. Although located in a quiet neighborhood, it is near restaurants, shops, groceries, museums, parks. The only time we took a short bus trip was to and from the train station. I would refer this hotel to anyone. It was a lovely experience and I wish I were there now.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: BSV1823
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the John Wayne room, the room was very large and comfortable. There is wi-fi on the first floor and you are in walking distance of most of the "attractions" about 15 to 20 minutes. Breakfast is included and that was an added plus. As everyone has said, the stairs are a killer! If I would have stayed a few mores days I could have been in Olympic shape. My only con is that there internet is only on the first floor and that the windows don't have mosquito coverings.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased”
Reviews.Author: CarolA97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights after three weeks in Eastern Turkey. We were interested in resting and visiting museums. The Hotel Keizershof was an excellent choice for us because we do not use the typical amenities such as pools and hotel restaurants that are common to most large establishments. The family was helpful and gracious while not intrusive. We had a key to the front door allowing us to schedule our own time. This point was important to us as we were tired from our earlier travels and returned to the hotel each afternoon to rest. The breakfast was excellent and the room was spacious, had large windows that opened to the canal and was quiet. The hotel was centrally located with easy access from the airport and to museums and restaurants. The stairs are steep and narrow but we left our medium sized suitcases in a locker at the airport and took only our daypacks and a small duffel bag to the hotel. Because our stay was short this was an excellent option for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: loriotr
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights in June, 2011. THe owner (don't remember his name) was very helpful, and gave us advice as to where to go, what to do, etc.. The room was quite a hike up the steep stairs (i think it was like 4 floors up), and we had the Charlie Chaplin room which was overlooking the canal. The hotel was very close to everything in Amsterdam, yet away from the tourist hustle and bustle. Breakfast was awesome, full spread of breads, cheeses, jams, yogurts with toppings, fruit, cookies, and he also made us yummy pancakes. I would definitely stay here again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: j_morkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kaizershof for a couple of days and then came back a week later. We found Ernest and Anika to be very friendly and helpful. Great restaurant suggestions. Stayed in the John Wayne room - only one with it's own toilet. Very roomy and comfrotable. Quite a hike up the stairs but that gave us the exercise to have another glass of wine. Amsterdam is quite expensive and we found the accommodations to be reasonably priced. Walking distance to everything but in a quieter area. Jack & TOni

Reviews.Title: “cheerful and helpful family, comfortable, delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ambersantacruz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this very friendly establishment. Our room on the 3rd floor looked out onto a beautiful garden, the bed was comfortable, the room was clean, there was a sink in the room and TV and the breakfast was AMAZING (more on that below). If we had more money, we would have stayed in the room with the private bath (I think it was 130 euros a night), but the bathroom was just a few steps from our door and the shower was literally right next door to our room (the garden room at 90 euros/night). In 5 nights we were only aware of sound from another room once and it was hardly audible. The street that this small hotel is on is very quiet. The 80 euros a night room overlooked the canal and would have been nice, but it was booked when we were there. Wifi is available but you have to be downstairs in the sitting room (which is a nice place to hang out) and Ernest will give you the computer password. The tram to almost everywhere was 1/2 block away (7 euros for an all day ticket was well worth it - buy it on board the tram) The family was incredibly friendly and helpful, there was a small quiet dog (no problem - only saw it twice in 6 days), and Ernest's mother is a dynamo and excellent cook and hostess. Now, the breakfast! If the room seemed expensive to me (it actually wasn't when compared to other high ranking hotels on Tripadvisor), the feast of a breakfast made the stay a real bargain. There were cereals, the best yogurt I ever tasted, dried fruit, often fresh fruit, cookies, pastries and sometimes cake, a wide array of cheeses (also delicious gouda, of course), a wide variety of breads and jams, tomato and mozzarella cheese with fresh basil salad, and an individually cooked omelet or Dutch pancake. But the best part of the breakfast was the absolutely delicious coffee served with hot milk. It ruined me for drinking any other coffee in Amsterdam. P.S. The stairs weren't that bed, but there are three floors of stairs. I always took a short breather on the second landing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendliness, and service!”
Reviews.Author: Virginiahilllcsw
Reviews.Content: We were in the middle of Amsterdam with easy bus access and a fairly short bus ride from the train station. Walking distance to Anne Frank House and VanGough Museum. Friendly and helpful with directions and even sent my daughter's forgotten text book back to us. Great morning breakfast that was the best we had on our 3 week journey! Loved being in the middle of it all, but also clean and quiet at night with a beautiful view of the homes back garden. We did fine with hauling our suitcase up the stairs, which is three flights. Even met some other guests at morning breakfast, which was really nice. I will definately stay again when I am in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: skye2406
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, quaint little hotel, well situated on a canal, within walking distance to almost anything in Amsterdam. I stayed here from April 1st to 5th with a friend. We had the rather spacious "Rita Hayworth" room, with a view of the garden, our own private facilities, very clean, and the breakfast served family style downstairs was just splendid. Add the very friendly owners and decent price, what more can you want? Perhaps a lift ... :-) The 49 steps were a bit daunting but manageable. Never forget, it's like stepping into a bit of history. I thoroughly recommend this place and plan to come back before I'm much older ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cric72
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location, at a walking distance from many places of interest. The owners are very pleasant, the room is clean, and the price is correct.

Reviews.Title: “Never thought find this place in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Lagartinho
Reviews.Content: Well, Keizershof Hotel is a family run "hotel". You stay at Mary's (the owner) house, who will make her best to help, advice, and provide you a good stay. What a nice person! I've stayed on the top floor, John Waiyne room, which is very large and confortable - you'll find a fridge and a LCD TV. The breakfast is also very good and the location is excelent. Prepare your legs for a big walk upstairs. It worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Matriarch Mary lends this hotel its warm, family atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: EGN7
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location, impeccable cleanliness and a copious, healthy breakfast (omelets plus eat all else you want) included in the fare distinguish this family run hotel from any other in Amsterdam. Owner Mary is here the grand, no-nonsense Matriarch, who is ever present, ever helpful. Location and breakfast lend this hotel (starting, realistically speaking, at about a hundred Euros for a couple, to be paid in cash) its exceptional value: Most attractions are literally within less than fifteen minutes walk, and the breakfast will save you big bucks on eating out. Though the house itself is one of the grand mansions that line the Keizersgracht, the hotel rooms, which occupy only the third and fourth floors, are nondescript simple, have no telephones, yet are exceptionally light and clean. But don't come with the intention to party here, and, if your luggage is heavy or cumbersome, make sure you have enough muscle to lug it up some steep stairs. One small suggestion for the owners: invest in heavier carpets, essential in this old house where noise travels easily from room to room. Our upstairs neighbor was heavy footed and an early riser, which meant we really couldn't sleep beyond 7:00.

Reviews.Title: “Great host-Great location-Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: mroterdam
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 12:30PM and were greeted by the owners with a warm smile. We were informed we should take our luggage up to our room and come down whenever we were ready to register. Our room (Charlie Chaplin) was very clean, large and cheerfully decorated. We had a shower/sink in our room (with blow dryer) and shared a toilet in the hall. Our internet signal was weak according to our laptops but we had no problems using the Wi-Fi in our room...fabulous! But, in case the signal is not good, there is a wonderful living room with comfortable couch and chairs and you should have no problems. Our host and her daughter and helper continued to be gracious and start us off each morning with a full breakfast (realize this value). You might be greeted by the host two cats. There was enough good food to last us all day. Outside of carrying up our luggage to the 3rd floor (spiral stairways) it was a wonderful place to stay. The location is very good too!! We could hear some noise from the street below but not much-nothing worth keeping you away.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there was a Hotel Keizershof in every city that I visit!”
Reviews.Author: ziggidyz
Reviews.Content: The owners of Hotel Keizershof, the De Vries familiy, are absolutely wonderful. At their hotel, you aren't just a guest, you feel as if you are staying with old friends. I have never stayed at a bed and breakfast, but that is how I would categorize this hotel. Upon arrival they gave me some tips about the area, made me feel right at home, yet I came and went as I pleased. My room was on the 1st floor with it's own staircase, so I didn't have to carry my suitcase too far. It overlooked the garden and although my stay was during the winter, I can only imagine how much more charming it will look in spring and summer. The room even had a beautiful antique fireplace with old delft tiles and it felt quite roomy. Although the amenities were basic, there was a tea pot in the room, the room/bathroom were clean, the bed was super comfortable, and they even had free wireless. Perhaps my favorite part was the amazing breakfast they served, I had a hard time believing it was all for the guests. If only the food in America was this good! The hotel is centrally located on a beautiful quiet canal. The tram stops right off of the street, so it's easy to get to from Central Station. Whether you want to walk to Dam square, go to the Van Gogh museum, or the Anne Frank House, they are easily accessible from the hotel. If I get to come back to Amsterdam, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel room, breakfast and location!”
Reviews.Author: Portland_and_beyond
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Our room was up on the 3rd floor with a gorgeous view of the canal. The spiral staircase to get there was tight and difficult to climb with luggage, but worth it! The room was comfortable and cozy with a very clean bathroom. Breakfast was fantastic and included and the host was most generous. She gave us museum passes to use that other guests had left after their stay - saved us at least 40euros each! The location is also perfect - within walking distance of all sights and close to the tram that gets you to central station. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Visit in a Beautiful City!”
Reviews.Author: lwhcchh
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I stayed at Hotel Keizershof for three nights in late October. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we booked our stay after reading some reviews and pricing some other options. We don't regret it and enjoyed our visit. The family own hotel, more like a bed and breakfast, was perfect for our needs. it is centrally located and very reasonably priced. Our room was on the third floor and if you did not pack light, you will certainly regret it once you reach the top! We chose a bedroom with a private sink and shared toilet and shower. We never saw any other guests but I know some of the other rooms were occupied. Although the room was not particularly up-to-date, it was tidy and clean. Keep in mind, we get up early and come back late. We wanted a room for sleeping and had little need for a big television and the other typically related amenities found in an a chain American hotel. We wanted some local flavor and this hotel provided it. Keep in mind it is old and there are some limitations. It is centrally located and most museums and other attractions are within easy walking distance (we like to walk . . . a lot!). Due to excellent directions provided by the owener, we easily found the hotel from Central Station using a streetcar. The owner and hostess, Mary, was delightful. She greeted us upon our arrival. The only surprises were pleasant ones. Mary and her daughter provided us excellent ideas for visiting museums and advised us concerning directions, schedules, etc. They were extremely helpful. We felt like we were staying in the home of one of our friends . .. . as it turned out we were! Now, concerning the breakfast. . . my son can eat! I usually have trouble waking him and getting him going, but after the first morning, he was up early and downstairs at the table! Mary prepared great omelettes and or waffles that accompanied a fine assortment of pastries, fruit, yogurt, cheese, sliced meats, cereals, fresh juice, coffee, tea, etc. My only problem was prying my son away from the table. All of this said, if you are expecting the big American chain with all the "amenities," this hotel is probably not for you. If you want to make some new friends, enjoy a quiet neighborhood and enjoy a true taste of Amsterdam, I recommend it. I feel like most of the previous favorable reviews are accurate. I can't speak about the negative comments because that was not our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Did you know you already had family in Amsterdam?”
Reviews.Author: hp18pilot
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Amsterdam and my first re-entry into international travel in several years. My four days and nights here at the Hotel brought back all the positive memories and feelings of getting out and seeing the world again. If your desire is to stay in the consistent surroundings and expectations of a nice La Quinta near the mall this is not the place for you. However, if you want to savor the experience of Dutch life provided by very caring and knowledgeable folks who just happen to treat you as extended family, enjoy your grandma's breakfast fresh every morning, be within walking distance of EVERYTHING, (caveat, I LOVE to walk), give your knees and balance a little workout toward your room, find in room TV's a distraction, but views of canals and gardens a pleasure, and an excellent, excellent value for your hard earned money, this is probably your place.My only tip would be to bring a small white noise machine if you like to sleep with a fan on like I do at home. It is not noisy, sometimes it is even too quiet, just a personal thing for me. If you go and this is your first time, listen to what Mary and her family recommends for you, it is always going to be the best time. I look forward to visiting Hanneke and Mary again soon. You will not regret your stay, unless your a big fan of the Malted Waffle griddles at a Stateside hotel chain. Thank you again Mary, Joseph

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hosts, breakfast and location...”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Mt_Lawley
Reviews.Content: Felt like I was staying with family or friends. Helpful advice available at any time and a very generous breakfast. Thanks ever so much for the museum pass. Shared bathroom and toilet a little tired in the decor department (but both clean and functional). Bedroom was clean and comfortable. The stairs will definitely be an issue for someone frail. NOTE: Enter through the black door at street level if you arrive after 5. Would definitely stay her again...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing can beat this hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Sequim132
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were greeted warmly. Our 3rd floor room faces the courtyard in the back and is quiet, spotlessly clean, with a great bed. We chose to have a room that uses the hall bathroom facilities but has a sink in the room. Breakfast is great and very filling. Our hostess and her family have made us feel very comfortable and has helped us plan our time.

Reviews.Title: “My Kind Of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyLuvsTheDutch
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here on my frequent visits to my favourite city for 25 years and I can't recommend it highly enough. Sometimes I've been alone, sometimes with friends and sometimes with relatives. Everyone is always made to feel at home by the de Vries family (mother, daughter and son). There are no frills here, but, my word, a visitor soon becomes one of the de Vries family! And the breakfasts are to die for. The rooms are clean, comfortable and the greatest mattresses I've ever slept on. Maybe I'll move in permanently!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent Family Owned and Operated!”
Reviews.Author: OldschoolExplorer
Reviews.Content: I love the family that runs this hotel; they are helpful, knowledgeable and so sweet. The location couldn't be better-you're close to all the fun, but not on the main drag-so it feels like it is your summer home on a residential street, rather than a hotel. The price was very low, and everything was clean and inviting and spacious (except the spiral stairs!). As other people have mentioned, the only hard part was the stairs: we stayed on the 3rd floor and had big, heavy bags. I wouldn't recommend this place for the elderly, only because the narrow spiral staircase would be dangerous for him/her. Another plus is the amazing garden in the backyard filled with beautiful flowers, a few statues, and even a few kitties! I would surely stay here again. P.S. they even had wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again anytime.”
Reviews.Author: FSammut
Reviews.Content: The location is fantasic, between the museum quarter and the city centre. 15 minutes interesting and comfortable stroll to Centraal Station, tram stop on corner 50 metres away, museums, Vondel Park ten minutes walk away. Antique and art shops very close by, self serve laundromat five minutes walk. Amsterdam is not a cheap city, but there are a number of cheaper, wholesome restaurants not far away. In particular there is a little one called GoFresh at 135 Vijzelgraccht just around the corner. It is run by an African guy who cooks your food on the spot, and it is as good and as fresh, with a reasonable variety of dishes, as you will find in any expensive restaurant. Filling, quality meals between euro 7.5 to 13.5. Believe me, when you are forking out money hand over fist at rip off dives, you appreciate some good, honest value. The hotel itself? Very comfortable, kind, obliging people, everyone speaks excellent English (and German and one or two others that I could make out). I concur with all the favourable comments I have read here about this hotel and the breakfast provided. The ensuite room faces the lovely back garden and the view is a delight. The room is quite large though slightly narrow, and has some very interesting and probably expensive old world features. Everything worked, and while the small staircase up is, well, interesting, you will always remember the experience of negotiating it pleasantly, providing you are in normal health. The hosts are proud, refined people, with a good Dutch sense of humour, who will go out of their way to oblige. But you must remember it is also their family home, and you should be prepared to afford your hosts the respect you would to anyone else who invites you into their house. If not, stay at the local hotel chain, where as a number yourself, you can treat others as numbers.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Place to Stay In Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Tessa801
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in early May 2010. I donâ€™t think there is a better place to stay in Amsterdam, if you can manage the stairs. Itâ€™s well located on a beautiful canal and an easy walk to all the main sights, including the main train station if you want to venture further on a day trip. As other reviewers have said, this is a family-run hotel and I felt like I was their house guest, not a hotel guest. The family is welcoming and helpful. They are really nice people. My room was on the canal side of the building and I liked that. I didnâ€™t have a problem with the occasional sounds. The room was very clean and very comfortable. It was lovely to arrive back in the evening and find that the heating was already on and the room was cosy. My room was big with an ensuite shower and sink. There was a shared toilet in the hall, but this was never a problem. The breakfasts are wonderful. A feast of fruit, cereals, yogurt, breads etc., and the famous omelettes. So delicious! I hope I have an opportunity to stay here some other time.

Reviews.Title: “A stay at Hotel Keizershof, is a MOST delightful Dutch experience!”
Reviews.Author: CherieW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Keizershof in April this year and it exceeded all our expectations. It is a charming seventeenth century canal-house, owned by the De Vries family and located on the picturesque Keizersgracht in the historic center of Amsterdam. We stayed in the Rita Hayworth room, a double room on the third floor overlooking the pretty gardens below. There was a shower and toilet in our room in addition to tea and coffee making facilities. The room was spotlessly clean and spacious, the doonas and pillows were soft and fluffy and the bed was very comfortable. Each morning we were served a delicious Dutch breakfast that consisted of juice, tea or coffee, cereal, yoghurt, jam and Mary's home-made bread and special omelettes or eggs and bacon. The Hotel Keizershof is within easy walking distance of all historic sites, including the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum, the Coster Diamonds Museum, Dam Square and the Amsterdam flower market. There are also some delightful pubs, great restaurants and little eateries nearby. We were staying at the Hotel Keizershof when there was an eruption at EyjafjallajÃ¶kull, Iceland on April 17. This meant that we were unable to fly home on 18th April. Mary, her daughter Hanneke and son Ernest did all they could to keep us up-to-date with the latest developments each day. The Hotel Keizershof became our 'home away from home' and the De Vries family 'our family' who cared and comforted us until we were finally able to get on a flight home 3 days later. When it came time to go, we were genuinely sorry to leave and will be forever grateful for the kindness that was shown to us during that time. So, if you all looking for a real Dutch family experience, look no further! The De Vries family are waiting to welcome you to their hotel. What are you waiting for? Go on, book it and I hope like us, you'll find that a stay at Hotel Keizershof is a MOST delightful experience! Cherie and Dick Wilkinson Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Inviting”
Reviews.Author: SiteSeeker
Reviews.Content: Welcoming hosts. Great location on nice canel. Big room. Great breakfast. Received good recommendations with directions. Some street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Europe”
Reviews.Author: IngukuTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming B&B for 3 nights in March of 2010. We were delighted with the room, location, breakfast and hospitality. The mother, daughter and son were gracious in every way. We found a Dutch cell phone on our first day and they were very helpful in translating the phone info and were able to contact the owner and secure it's safe return. This time was above and beyond they obligation, but they were delightful to assist. Our room (Marlene Detrich Room on the 3rd floor) was large with a sink, table and chairs and a tv. We had a lovely view of their garden. The breakfasts were grand!!! Mary, the mother, provided us with numerous choices, toast, buns, caramel filled wafers, cornflakes, musleix, cheeses, fresh and dried fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea and a daily hot option. One day we had dutch pancakes with fresh strawberries and nutella. The second day we had cheese omlettes with chives. The third we had to leave early to catch the train on `easter. The son kindly gave us a bag of chocolate Easter cookies. We never had any cookie as good before. Each day they gave us tips on things to do and where to go. And they even shared their living space in the evening. We had a great time sharing stories about travel, family and their B&B business. Now we feel obligated to address the stairs. We stayed on the 3rd floor and did not struggle with the stairs. We expected stairs in Europe. And the twist, just made them more charming. If anyone has trouble with them, they may need to consider less luggage. If you do want to stay here and are concerned about the stairs book early and get the room on the 1st floor. We traveled Europe for 6 weeks and this by far was our favorite place to stay. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “welcome home”
Reviews.Author: pedrosocal
Reviews.Content: Each April I visit Amsterdam for a week of meetings. I want a place to stay where I feel at home, with a location convenient to the central city, with charm and personality. I return to Hotel Keizershof every year for these reasons and more. When I arrive from America, tired and jet lagged, Mary or Hanneke greet me at the door with, "Hello, Peter. Welcome home!" My room is a great value, looks out over the Keizersgracht, and has everything I need. Each morning Mary makes me a delicious omelette or pankoeken, freshly squeezed orange juice, hot and fresh bread, and I enjoy my meal seated around a table with fellow travelers from around the world. When I want to go out and enjoy the city, it's on my doorstep. Who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: webgal7
Reviews.Content: A great Bed & Breakfast hotel that has a very accommodating owner. She'll make an omelet breakfast if you wish and send you on your way from a very central location. The B & B is within a couple of blocks north of the Rijksmuseum and just several blocks south of Dam Square. Our room overlooked one of the many canals which while scenic does expose you to a little of the night noise from pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and out $150”
Reviews.Author: Fraumutter
Reviews.Content: I was planning to travel to Amsterdam alone with my 2 children (10 & 15) the summer of 2009 and was looking for a place I would feel safe in, good location, historic if possible, and one that was within my budget. I liked what I saw on the internet for Hotel Keizershof, and since the exchange rate for the Canadian Dollar was poor at the time, I simply wrote and asked if theyâ€™d be willing to give me a discount. They agreed, and I was delighted with the rate they offered. When we got there, however, they looked at us blankly and claimed I had led them to believe I had LITTLE children. Though I felt sure I had included the ages of my children, I could not be 100% certain because I had written to so many places. I simply apologized and hoped they would let us stay since my 15 year old felt ill and barely made it there. I was carrying his luggage and mine! They begrudgingly let us in but made it clear that they were unhappy about us. We felt most unwelcome. In an effort to be just I offered to pay more. For the 3 nights we were there my children hardly ate any breakfast, and on one day my 15 year old didnâ€™t eat at all because he was so ill. At my request our hostess didnâ€™t change any linen or do anything in the room for the day he was ill in bed. That negated her arguments that older children eat more and use more water. I was kindly permitted to use her computer and internet to contact my husband to let him know we arrived safely, but she sat and watched what I wrote, so I didnâ€™t feel free to check up the email I had written to her to see if I had included the ages of my children. However, I did check after we left Amsterdam, and I had most clearly stated their ages! My husband wrote to her, pointing out how unwelcome we felt and that the $150 I had paid on top of the price she had offered us really was uncalled for since I had been upfront about their ages, but of course we never heard back. I was really disappointed. I had given her the benefit of the doubt and tried to be fair and honest but she did not return that courtesy. Next time I will take copies of all agreements along. About the room: it opens to the canal. Very noisy at night. All the sounds seem to echo up, especially the carts on cobblestone at 4 am. The people cruising down the canal with their stereos on can be clearly heard, as can conversations. Bring ear plugs and a big mosquito net. It folds quite small into a suitcase, but comes in really handy frequently in Europe, since many places donâ€™t have screens or air conditioning. And yes, the staircase is as bad as everyone says it is. Large suitcases would simply not fit! Breakfast was varied. The hostess wasnâ€™t feeling well while we were there, so I was offered an omelet once and on one day her daughter made one for only two of about 12 people, but the rest of us didnâ€™t get an offer, and we were finished eating by the time she had finished those omelets. The rest of the breakfast was fine. There was a tiny kettle and fresh flowers in the room which made it cheery. Do your own research on eateries and such, as you may not get any help here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel of our trip; charming spacious room”
Reviews.Author: TazDenverColorado
Reviews.Content: In spite of the very steep steps to our room, we were delighted with our choice. Our hosts were beyond friendly and even contributed food to our lunches for our train trip after we left. We like to find one-of-a-kind charming places wherever we visit and this hotel was memorable. We had a lovely view of the garden, a large room and all the usual amenities, plus helpful and charming hosts. It's location could not have been better. If you like your hotel rooms to be different from the ordinary, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience, wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thohing
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience! It was fabulous in every way: location, genial hosts, a beautiful clean and spacious room (we stayed on the top floor overlooking the garden with a stunning view of the Rijksmuseum); and a hearty, delicious breakfast of eggs, fresh fruit and various breads and cheeses every morning. The deVries family is lovely and were a terrific resource for exploring Amsterdam. We can't say enough positive things about our stay. Negatives? Only that you need to be aware there is a very steep spiral staircase leading upstairs. It's not a chain hotel -- obviously. This is a place where you stay IN Amsterdam and are able to enjoy the city and all it has to offer. A five-star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, up a tiny stair case”
Reviews.Author: rkEuroTrip09
Reviews.Content: We had a HUGE room with a private shower, and toilet down the hall. Room, shower & bathroom were very clean. Staff very nice, much like a pension. Could hear ALL of the street noise... Get a room on the back if you stay here. EXCELLENT breakfast--will sometimes make eggs if they have them. Tiny circular stair case, difficult to walk up with a back pack on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darkfang
Reviews.Content: I was really please with my choice about this Hotel (more a B&B than a Hotel). We can see what a house look like in Amsterdam.. This is soo narrow :P. The room was large though but no elevator and the spiral stairs and a pain when you have big luggage, hehehe. But this is part of being in Amsterdam. We stay in the Charlie Chaplin room on the third floor with the view on the Canal. We stay 2 nights and we enjoy only 1 breakfast since our train was leaving at 8am for the second day. Mary did some great pie, cookies. There was a lot of thing to eat!! :P and really delicious!

Reviews.Title: “What Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: LexingtonTravelers
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! What a family! What a wonderful experience. We arrived and were immediately greeted by Hannake, the daughter running the hotel. She gave us many suggestions of wonderful things to do in Amsterdam and was extremely friendly. Mary, her mother, served homemade bread and pancakes for breakfast with the most wonderful spread of food I've ever seen in europen hotels (with cold milk for all Americans not used to the warm milk idea) Be warned, they aren't kidding when they say the spiral stair case creates problems. It's very difficult to get your luggage up the stairs if you haven't packed light. However, the view, the staff and the price really sold this hotel as one of my favorites. Would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Dutch Treat”
Reviews.Author: dutchtreat23
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon last year (September 2007) and felt it was necessary to write a review. Better late than never... What can I say other than what a wonderful experience. For all the guest complaining about warm orange juice, moquitoes I feel that you need to spend the money and stay in a five star palace. People always want the most value for their money and this is the place for an inexpensive (by Amsterdam standards) authentic Dutch experience. Food, service, cleanliness and location was impeccable. The hot breakfast was more than adequete and kept us fueled until later that day. To spend money on breakfast in Amsterdam with what you recieve you would be paying up toward 20 euros per person. Give this place a chance if you want to stay in a canal house in the heart of Amsterdam with wonderful breakfast, comfortable rooms and a true B&B experience. We loved it and I hope you will too

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Dutch”
Reviews.Author: Isladar
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Keizershof in the Rick Steves guidebook, and based on his review (and the reviews on this site) we gave it a shot. A word up front (something to be aware of): this is a cash only establishment. Fortunately it is inexpensive enough that this isn't a problem. It is a family run hotel (more of a B&B, really), and everyone is friendly, kind, and courteous. The room was clean and spacious and the view of the city was pleasant. We stayed for more than five days, so we were given a discount on the room of (two bedroom en suite dropped from 115 euro a night to 100 euro a night). The breakfasts included fresh fruit, bread, and cheese, and a very tasty omelette each morning. It is conveniently located next to a tram line (fourth stop from Centraal on the 16, 24, 25 trams) and a block from a grocery store. It is a 10 to 15 minute walk from the Rijksmusem and the Van Gogh Museum, and 5 to 10 minutes from the Leidesplein. When I travel to Amsterdam in the future I will be sure to stay in the Hotel Keizershof

Reviews.Title: “plusses and minuses fpr this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizpaul
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located in the canal district of Amsterdam. It is an old canal house complete with spiral wooden staircase, not easy to manoevre with big suitcases. The room was clean and airy and the bathroom spacious. Shower had to be held by hand. Breakfasts were big with the same omlet offered every day, (herb) but choices of cereal, breads, fruit salad and cakes. Only room for 10 or so at the table, so wait your turn if you arrive later. Hospitality was sporadic with the hostess sometimes very friendly and at other times distinctly not so. We ran out of tea bags, then milk then sugar in our room having more than one cup each per day, and came down the 5 storeys to get refills from her. She was fine at first but then begrudgingly allowed us a handful. Left a note for the maid to refill one or all of these and explained that we had gone to get some ourselves several times, whereupon she left us nothing, just 2 dirty cups! Would I stay there again? Probably not. I prefer a consistently postive interaction with the owners.

Reviews.Title: “Not the experience or hospitality that is advertised or was expected.”
Reviews.Author: europefan29
Reviews.Content: We were very excited when we found the review and information on the hotel. It sounded very historic, in a good location and that people enjoyed staying there b/c of the great breakfast and great hospitality. Unfortunately, this was not our experience at all. My boyfriend and I were travelling Europe, it was his first time, my upteenth..or so. The hotel was as expected. We were warned about the stairs and the travel up, so i did't expect to have any help or warning with that, but the stairs are very narrow and steep, so travel light, or be ready for a strong work out. The rooms were simple, but clean. Our problem was upon our arrival. The problems started when we first came to hotel - we had told them we would be there at about 10 am after getting through customs, etc and getting a ride from the airport. This was our first stop on our trip as well, so we were very jetlagged and tired. When she answered the door, it was as if we were putting her out, she did not seem happy to see us and told us our room was not ready (even though my email confirmation said it would be upon us coming at 10am). She said it woudl be ready in an hour and we were fine with that and did a quick tour at the Anne Frank House. We came back and took a nap. When we left that nite, i just happened to notice that the room said it was 100 Euro a nite, instead of the 80 we were promised in the email i had. I brought this up to the lady and she said 'oh you are in teh wrong room, we will have to switch you tomorrow'. i asked her why we could not switch thena nd she said our room was taken. i said well i am not goign to pay full price and she said yes you are b/c you just told me....it was still the same day and i did not think this was fair. Then we made the mistake of asking her where the 'bull dog' is. we were told it was a good place to go eat and instead it is actually a 'coffee shop'. we did not know this and she started to yell at me saying there is no smokin in the hotel and that is a place to get Marijuana. i assured her that we were not there to do drugs and just were told it was a place to eat and if she had a better palce in mind. she just said 'just go in that direction and you find something'. not very friendly or the kind of advice we were expecting. the next morning we came down for breakfast but were told our other room was not ready, so we needed to take a nap and told her we were goign to do this and her maid siad to just let her know when we were ready to change rooms later and would do this. we took a nap until 2 or so and went down and she said we could no longer exchanage rooms. i asked why and she started to yell at me again saying that her maid was gone and could not switch us. i said we can move our own luggage, etc, and she said that she was not going to do it and started to falsely accuse us of things we were doing in Amsterdam that she did not approve of and that we were goign to give her a heart attack with all our arguing with her. I simply did not say anythign to her!!! i told her it was not our fault for being put in the wrong room after her tantrum, and were not goign to pay full price and we agreed to pay in the middle. we were never offered anything extra at teh breakfast buffet, and when i went down the next morning without my boyfriend, she asked where he was and i said he has jet lag and she said 'yeah, amongst other things'. I was offended that again she was making assumptions and she just slammed my silverware and plates down in front of me and i asked for coffee andshe never brought it, but instead told us to pay her. She was a very rude hostess, not welcoming, and we also had to ask her five times to get us a cab for the airport. We felt like we were staying at our grandmother's house. We are in our mid 30's, not teegagers or partiers. we came to see the sights and did not feel like returning to the hotel except to sleep. buyer beware here, i have never been treated so rudely.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cortona
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my cousin in March of last year. It was great, I think we had the Rita Hayworth room. It was at the back of the house with our own staircase, we had a toilet upstairs and a private shower/toilet downstairs. The room was huge with a great bed and a huge dresser. We aren't exactly the lightest of packers and we were able to spread out all 4 huge suitcases on the floor easily! The breakfast was excellent, we were the only ones at the table one morning and the owner made us omelets with produce from her garden! There is a great restaurant a few blocks to the left (your back facing the hotel), go early and get the price fix menu.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dutch and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jrando
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 5 - mom, dad, 2 teenage age girls and a 12 year old girl. In short, we loved it. It was very much a B&B experience, with Mary alsways there to answer questions or make suggestions. The climb up the twisting staircase to our rooms in the 16th century canal building was so much more memorbale than a high speed elevator ride would have been. We had a view of their charming courtyard from our room. And it was a pleasure to sit in that courtyard and talk with the owners - Mary and her daughter Annika (sp?). The rooms were spacious and clean. Breaksfast was lovely. and the location on a quiet canal was perfect. I would highly recommend this place to anyone seeking a unique experience. We are going back this summer and we're psyched!

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Spoda
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my second stay this year at the Hotel Keizershof. This stay was for 3 nights with my family in one of the rooms on the top floor, overlooking the gardens in the rear (very quiet). The Keizershof is a fantastic dutch B&B experience, with a wonderful family as your hosts. Location is fantastic, with great access to some of the best local dining and other attractions in Amsterdam. The tram stop is also very close to the hotel, 2 minutes walking distance. Stairs are very steep as expected in a canal house, so pack lightly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B, Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: grenille
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the Hotel Keizershof has large, lovely, clean rooms with great views, is in a prime location, and serves a wonderful breakfast. Would I stay here again? Yes. Was it without problems? No. You need to know right off the bat that this is not a hotel, no matter what they call it. This is a B&B. Don't expect a front desk with services; you're staying in someone's home with no phones and family members milling around. That's fine, but they do represent themselves as a hotel, and it's just not true. Yes, they do have a lounge with a t.v., but we were never invited to use it; usually the owner's daughter was playing in front of it and watching cartoons while we ate breakfast 5 feet away. Also, forget the "4 rooms" and "65 euro" that you will see advertised elsewhere. They now have, as far as I can tell, between 8-10 rooms, and no room goes for less than 90 euros, even in the off season. Also, be aware that the fact that you are in an old house means thin walls and very creaky floors. Ask for a room on the very top floor to avoid the noise. On the up side, the breakfast was wonderful, the rooms are quite clean and definitely huge, the views are great, the family is eccentric but friendly. If you like the European B&B experience, definitely stay here. If you need hotel amenities, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is very quaint and perfectly located. There is just something about sleeping in a canal house that was built in the 1640's! Mary and her daughter are excellent hosts. Our "Rita Hayworth" room was very clean and the breakfast each morning was great. The hotel has a definite B&B feel- it was fun eating at the breakfast table with the other guests talking about our Amsterdam experiences. Mary was particularly helpful, waiting up for us when we got lost while driving from Paris to Amsterdam and even arranging a taxi pick up for us. Amsterdam is a wonderful city- be adventurous! People in the service industry (hotels, etc.) will advise you not to rent bikes and will try to convince you that you will be run over, however, it is the ONLY way to see the city!

Reviews.Title: “Had a very good time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hosts were pleasant, and gave excellent touring advice concerning both Amsterdam and the Hague. Breakfast was quite good, and they even gave us a small bottle of wine for the evening. The stairs were quite steep, but that is simply the nature of canal houses. We had the Marlene Dietrich room -- The room was very comfortable and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in the Keizerhof Hotel in late April 2004 and had a truly marvelous time!!! We stayed in the Marlene Dietrich room, which had a beautiful view of the family garden below us. The DeVries family, which ran the hotel, were very warm, inviting, and accomodating. The location of the hotel is very convenient (along a canal) to the center of Amsterdam. The very modest price which they charge for the room is well worth it. We would highly recommend it. We intend to come back to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A charming family run hotel. Well located on one of the main grachts just a short walk from Rembrandtsplein, Leidseplein and Reijksmuseum. Rather steep stairs to the rooms which are each named after film stars: John Wayne, Charlie Chaplin, Rita Hayworth etc. Excellent breakfast served in the family living room or garden (weather permitting). You are assured of a truly warm, Dutch welcome. My first choice every time.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Keizershof
HotelInfo.Address: Keizersgracht 618, Amsterdam 1017 ER, The Netherlands
